A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of medicated chewing gum.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of implant.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single inhaler container.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of insert.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single jar container.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of lozenge.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of lyophilisate.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of matrix.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of pad.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of paper.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of pastille.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of patch.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single pen container.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of pendant.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of pessary.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of pillule.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single pipette administration device.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of plaster.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of plug.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form or container is a type of pouch.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single sachet container.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of sponge.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is administered by filling a single spoon administration device.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of stick.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single straw container.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of strip.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of suppository.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single syringe container.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of system.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of tablet.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of tag.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of tampon.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of thread.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single tube container.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single vessel-type container.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single vial container.
A unit of presentation used to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of swab.
A unit of presentation to represent the quantity of product that is found in a single discrete entity where the pharmaceutical dose form is a type of bait.
Administration of a medicinal product to the ear.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product by dipping the beak of birds into an aqueous solution of the medicinal product.
Administration of a medicinal product to the buccal cavity (pouch located between the cheek and the gum) to obtain a systemic effect
Administration of a medicinal product to the skin and/or cutaneous wounds and/or nails and/or hair in order to obtain a local effect.
Administration of a medicinal product to and/or in the teeth or, on and/or around the nerves supplying the teeth.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product by immersing the animal into a bath or plunge pool containing the medicinal product.
Administration of a medicinal product to the cervix uteri.
Administration of a medicinal product to the sinuses to obtain a local effect.
Administration of a medicinal product to the trachea and/or bronchi by instillation (preparations for inhalation are excluded; see inhalation use).
Injection of a medicinal product into the epidural space.
Administration of a medicinal product onto a lesion.
Injection of a medicinal product between chorion and amnion.
Use of a medicinal product outside the body
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product into the foot of birds.
Administration of a medicinal product to the gastroenteral tract by means of an appropriate device. For use only when gastric use and intestinal use do not apply.
Administration of a medicinal product to the stomach by means of an appropriate device
Administration of a medicinal product to the gingivae.
Clearance of the blood by means of a semipermeable membrane. [Previous English term 'Hemodialysis' corrected 04/07/11.]
Insertion of an implant or living tissue equivalent into living tissue.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product by incorporation into the animal drinking water.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product by incorporation into the animal drinking water, milk or milk replacer. [Previous English term 'In drinking water or milk use' corrected 28/03/2011.]
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product through the shell into an embryonated egg.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product by incorporation into the animal feed.

Administration of a veterinary medicinal product into a bee hive, for example by placing it in a bee hive, sprinkling or spraying it over or into a bee hive, or converting it into a vapour with an appropriate vaporisation device such that the vapour enters the bee hive.
Method of administration, usually by injection, whereby a fluid passes into a target tissue (e.g. anaesthetic infiltration)

Administration of a medicinal product to the respiratory system by inhalation to obtain a systemic or a local effect in the lower respiratory tract. Nasal use and endotracheopulmonary use are excluded
Administration of a medicinal product to the intestine (duodenum, jejunum, ileum and colon) by means of an appropriate device. Gastroenteral use is excluded
Injection of a medicinal product into the amniotic cavity.
Injection of a medicinal product into an artery.
Injection of a medicinal product into an articular cavity.
Injection of a medicinal product into bursae and tendons.
Administration of a medicinal product directly into the anterior chamber of the eye
Injection of a medicinal product into the cardiac muscle and/or cardiac cavity. Cardioplegic use is excluded.
Administration of a medicinal product into the cartilage
Injection of a medicinal product into the corpus cavernosum.
Administration of a medicinal product directly to the brain tissue. This term is only for use when a more-specific term (e.g. 'Intraputaminal use') is not applicable.
Injection of a medicinal product into the cervix uteri.

Injection of a medicinal product into the bile duct and the pancreatic duct, for example via a cannula introduced into the ampulla of Vater (the common opening of the ducts), usually for the administration of a contrast medium for techniques such as endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP).
Administration of a medicinal product into the cisterna magna.
Injection of a medicinal product into the coronary artery. Cardioplegic use is excluded.
Injection of a medicinal product into the dermis.
Injection of a medicinal product into the nucleus pulposus of an intervertebral disc.
Administration of a medicinal product into the epidermis
Administration of a medicinal product directly into a gland, usually by injection. Only to be used where more-specific terms such as 'Intraprostatic use' and 'Intramammary use' do not apply.
Administration by injection or any other means of a medicinal product directly to a lesion.
Injection of a medicinal product into a lymphatic vessel.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product into the intramammary gland via the teat canal.
Injection of a medicinal product into skeletal muscle tissue.

Administration of a medicinal product into the eye. The term 'intraocular use' is only for use when a more specific term (e.g. 'intracameral use', 'intravitreal use') does not apply. Ocular use and subconjunctival use are excluded.
Administration of a medicinal product into the bone marrow. Intrasternal use is excluded.
Injection of a medicinal product to the pericardium.
Injection of a medicinal product into the peritoneal cavity.
Injection of a medicinal product into the pleural cavity.
Injection/infusion of a medicinal product into the hepatic portal vein for local delivery to the liver.
Administration of a medicinal product into the prostate
Administration of a medicinal product into the lung, usually by injection. 'Inhalation use' and 'Endotracheopulmonary use' are excluded.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product into the rumen.
Injection of a medicinal product into the bone marrow of the sternum.
Injection of a medicinal product through the dura to the subarachnoid cavity.
Injection of a medicinal product into a tumor.
Administration of a medicinal product to the cavity of the uterus.
Injection of a medicinal product into a vein.
Administration of a medicinal product to the urinary bladder.
Administration of a medicinal product into the rear chamber of the eye.
Introduction of (an) ionised active substance(s) through the intact skin by application of a direct electric current
Administration of a medicinal product to the laryngopharynx for a local effect (anaesthetics).
Administration of a medicinal product to the nose to obtain a systemic or local effect. Inhalation therapy intended for the lower respiratory tract is excluded; see inhalation use.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product converted into an aerosol for mass medication, for example of birds.
Administration of a medicinal product upon the eyeball and/or conjunctiva.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product by instillation (dropping) into the eyes and nares of individual animals (usually birds), or spraying onto the animals to achieve the same effect.
Taking a medicinal product by means of swallowing.

Administration of a medicinal product to the oral cavity to obtain either a systemic or a local effect. The term oromucosal is only for use when a more specific term (e.g. buccal, gingival, sublingual...) does not apply. Oral use is excluded.
Administration of a medicinal product to the oropharynx (throat) to obtain a local effect.
Injection of a veterinary medicinal product along the spinal column of animals.
Injection of a medicinal product around a joint.
Injection of a medicinal product into the direct surroundings of one or more nerves.
Administration to the pouch between the tooth and the gingiva.
Administration of a medicinal product on or around the bone
Administration of a medicinal product directly into the region surrounding a tumour.
Administration of a medicinal product beneath the sub-tenon membrane of the sclera (i.e. in the episcleral space), adjacent to the macula.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product by pouring onto the dorsal midline of the animal or to the top of the head and around the base of the horns.
Administration of a medicinal product to the rectum in order to obtain a local or systemic effect.
Administration of a medicinal product behind the eyeball
Applies to medicinal products not directly coming into contact with the body of the patient, or administration to various or non-specified anatomical sites.
Administration of a medicinal product by scratching the skin.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product to a single site on the back of the animal or the base of the poll of the head.
Injection of a medicinal product underneath the conjunctiva.
Injection of a medicinal product directly underneath the skin, i.e. subdermally
Administration of a medicinal product under the tongue to obtain a systemic effect.
Injection of a medicinal product directly underneath a mucosa
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product to the surface of teat(s). Teat dipping is included.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product by application onto the surface of the feed immediately prior to feeding.
Administration of a medicinal product to the skin in order to obtain a systemic effect after passing through the skin barrier.
Administration of a medicinal product to the urethra.
Administration of a medicinal product to the vagina.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product to aquatic (marine or fresh water) species by medication of the water environment.
Administration of a veterinary medicinal product into the wing-web of a bird.
Administration of a medicinal product into the cerebral ventricles (cerebral ventricular system) of the brain.
Administration of a medicinal product between the sensory retina (neural retina) and the retinal pigment epithelium of the eye.
Administration of a medicinal product into the cornea of the eye.
Administration of a medicinal product into one or both of the putamen of the brain.
Injection of a medicinal product directly outside the pleural cavity, between the parietal pleura and the endothoracic fascia.
Administration, usually by injection, of a medicinal product into the tissue surrounding a lesion.

Administration of a medicinal product, for example by infusion into the aortic root (antegrade cardioplegia) or coronary sinus (retrograde cardioplegia) of the isolated heart, to induce cardiac arrest during heart surgery.
Injection of a medicinal product into the detrusor muscle of the bladder.

Container consisting of two layers of which one is shaped to contain the individual unit, usually provided with perforations, the intention being to allow each individual unit to be separated for single unit administration. All the information required for blister packs must appear on each unit dose presentation. Blisters and strips are excluded.

Filled container, usually fitted with an injection needle, which may or may not be fitted with a needle safety device, containing a sterile, single-dose parenteral preparation. This term is only to be used when a more-specific term such as 'Pre-filled syringe' or 'Pre-filled pen' is not appropriate.

Filled container for administering a liquid or semi-solid pharmaceutical form to the oral cavity, containing the final preparation in one compartment, or the components necessary for its preparation in different compartments.

Filled container for administering a liquid or semi-solid pharmaceutical form to the oral cavity, containing the final preparation in one compartment, or the components necessary for its preparation in different compartments. This term may be used to describe a pre-filled oral syringe in cases where there is a risk of administration error, e.g. where a similar product is often administered by injection, such as with vaccines.

Single-dose or multidose container, usually consisting of a single flexible surface (which may consist of one or more layers and may be coated) intended to be used to enclose one or more units of a solid preparation such as a tablet or lozenge. Multidose wrappers may be used to present the individual units of a medicinal product together in the form of a roll that can be torn or otherwise opened to allow the removal of the required number of units. Blisters, sachets, strips and unit-dose blisters are excluded.

Item of packaging intended for use as an intermediate or outer container, intended to contain one or more medicinal product(s); it is made of a flexible material and may be for single use or be re-usable, and may be fitted with a closure system. Bags and sachets are excluded.

Rigid, cylindrical container that is closed at one end, usually intended for fragile tablets such as effervescent tablets, and which is designed to allow the tablets to be stacked in a single column, thereby reducing the likelihood of physical damage caused by impacts with each other or the container wall. The open end can be reclosed, and in the case of effervescent tablets, a desiccant is usually integrated into the closure.

Container consisting of an assembly of cylinders suited for compressed, liquefied or dissolved gas, which are fastened together in a frame and interconnected by a manifold, and are transported and used as a single unit. It is fitted with a device to regulate the spontaneous outflow of gas at atmospheric pressure and room temperature.
Container sealed by fusion and to be opened exclusively by breaking. The contents are intended for use on one occasion only.

Container consisting of surfaces, whether or not with a flat bottom, made of flexible material, generally closed at the bottom and at the sides by sealing; at the top possibly to be closed by fusion of the material, depending on the intended use. Equipped with special attachments. Contains the final preparation in one compartment or the components necessary for its preparation in different compartments.
Container of large size, suited for liquid, solid and semi-solid pharmaceutical forms.
Container (usually multidose) consisting of two layers of which one is shaped to contain the individual doses. Strips and unit-dose blisters are excluded.
Container with a more or less pronounced neck and usually a flat bottom.
Primary container consisting of one or more parts made of a light material, can be closed.

Filled container, usually cylindrical, containing a sterile, single-dose or multidose, parenteral preparation; it contains the final preparation in one compartment, or the components necessary for its preparation in different compartments. It may be supplied as an integral part of a pre-filled pen or be intended for use in a reusable device especially designed for that purpose, such as a pen. Dose-dispenser cartridges are excluded.

An item of packaging that is used for the storage, identification and/or transport of a medicinal product. Only to be used where more-specific terms do not apply. Specific characteristics of the container are defined in the product information of the medicinal product.
A pointed missile which on contact with an animal delivers its medicinal content.
Container intended for use in a dose dispenser, usually pre-filled with a medicinal product. Cartridges, intended for use in pens, are excluded.
Container for a pharmaceutical form to be applied by dredging.
A container, usually a bottle, fitted with a dropper applicator.
A static thermally insulated container designed to maintain the contents in the liquid state
Container usually cylindrical suited for compressed, liquefied or dissolved gas, fitted with a device to regulate the spontaneous outflow of gas at atmospheric pressure and room temperature.

Container, without a pronounced neck, with a wide opening at the top and a more-or-less flat bottom. It is suited for semi-solid and solid pharmaceutical forms (including those that are stored/supplied in a liquid medium, such as living tissue equivalents). It can be reclosed.
A mobile thermally insulated container designed to maintain the contents in a liquid state.
A container holding a quantity of the preparation suitable for 2 or more doses.
Multidose container with an integral pump designed to protect the contents against in use-contamination.
Multidose container with integral metering pump.
Multidose container with an integral pump. Metering pump, spray pump, and multidose container with airless pump are excluded.
Container with built-in applicator for pouring-on use.
Pre-filled tube for the administration of a medicinal product to the gastroenteral tract.

Filled container consisting usually of a cartridge, usually fitted with an injection needle, housed in a pen device that may or may not be fitted with a needle safety device. The cartridge contains a sterile, single-dose or multidose, parenteral preparation; it contains the final preparation in one compartment, or the components necessary for its preparation in different compartments. The cartridge is not replaceable and the pre-filled pen is intended to be discarded when empty. The pre-defined dose, which may or may not be adjustable, is administered via an actuation, such as the pressing of a button.

Filled container consisting of an injection syringe, generally supplied with an injection needle, which may or may not be fitted with a needle safety device. It contains a sterile, single-dose or multidose, parenteral preparation; it contains the final preparation in one compartment, or the components necessary for its preparation in different compartments. The pre-filled syringe is intended to be discarded when empty.

Container suited for compressed, liquefied or dissolved gas fitted with a device to enable, after its actuation, a controlled spontaneous release of the contents at atmospheric pressure and room temperature.
A container, usually a bottle, fitted with a roll-on applicator
Container consisting of two surfaces made of flexible material to be closed only by sealing or folding over. The contents are intended for single use.
A container that holds a quantity of the preparation intended for total or partial use on one occasion only.
Container for a liquid pharmaceutical form to be converted into a spray by mechanical means.
Hollow tube containing a single dose of a medicinal product for oral administration by sucking.
Multidose container consisting of two layers, usually provided with perforations, suited for containing single doses of solid or semi-solid preparations. Blisters are excluded.
Container without a neck and with a flat bottom, suited for tablets, capsules, etc., which can be re-closed well. Tablet tube is excluded.
Container for semi-solid pharmaceutical forms, usually multidose, consisting of collapsible material intended to release the contents via a nozzle by squeezing the package.
Small container for parenteral medicinal products, with a stopper and overseal; the contents are removed after piercing the stopper. Single-dose and multidose uses are included.

Closure that regulates the release of the contents from a container (e.g. a gas cylinder) by adjusting the opening of the exit duct, usually allowing a continuous flow of the contents out of the container; a device that controls the movement of the valve may be incorporated. 'Metering valve' and 'Spray valve' are excluded.
Fitted closure, generally one that snaps shut onto a container to maintain a seal.
Closure with brush device.
Hollow object without screw thread, mostly cylindrical, meant to close a container.
A closure which is difficult for young children to open but which is not difficult for adults to open properly.
Closure whereby a measured quantity of the contents is released by mechanical actuation of the pump.
Closure whereby a measured quantity of the contents is released by actuation of the valve.
Closure with a needle.
Closure with pipette.
Hollow cylindrical object with screw thread, meant to close a container.
Closure whereby the contents are released as a spray by mechanical actuation of the pump.
Closure whereby the contents are released as a spray by mechanical actuation of the valve.
More or less solid cylindrical or conical object meant to close a container by insertion.

Administration device for administering a liquid or semi-solid pharmaceutical form to the oral cavity. This term may be used to describe an oral syringe in cases where there is a risk of administration error, e.g. where a similar product is often administered by injection, such as with vaccines. It may contain one or more components necessary for the preparation of the final product (e.g. the solvent), but it does not contain the final preparation or all of its components; in such cases, use 'Pre-filled oral applicator' instead.

Administration device intended to house a cartridge that contains a sterile, single-dose or multidose, parenteral preparation. It is usually supplied without a fixed needle, and may or may not be fitted with a needle safety device. The cartridge is usually replaceable when it is empty. The pre-defined dose, which may or may not be adjustable, is administered via an actuation, such as the pressing of a button. Dose dispenser is excluded.
System including syringes, cartridges, etc. that requires manipulation prior to administration of the medicinal product.
Administration device used to apply a drug to or into a certain site of the body.
Device for the delivery of a preset dose of the product by injection to a number of animals in turn.
Device for delivery of a solid dose into the throat of the animal.
Administration device fitted with a fine brush used for the application of liquid pharmaceutical forms.
Administration device, tubular with a conical tip used for the application of liquid or semi-solid pharmaceutical forms.
Administration device used for the administration of a quantity, whether or not accurately measured, of a liquid or multidose solid pharmaceutical form.
Closure with dabbing device.

Device for the dispensing of a specified quantity of a medicinal product, for example an automatic electronic counter. Pre-filled pens, pre-filled syringes, inhalers, metering pumps, etc. are excluded.
Closure with dredging device.
Device for administering an oral liquid to an animal.
Screw cap with dropper.
Device for administering implants.
Device for administration of a medicinal product for inhalation. Nebuliser is excluded.
Device for automatic injection into embryonated eggs.
Hollow needle with a locking device intended for the administration of liquid pharmaceutical forms.

Administration device, cylindrical, with a cannula-like nozzle, with or without a fixed needle (which may or may not be fitted with a needle safety device), and a movable piston with piston rod used for the administration, usually parenteral, of an accurately measured quantity of a liquid pharmaceutical form.
Graduated device for connection to a container for administering a cutaneous liquid to an animal.
Device for introducing a pharmaceutical form through the teat canal.
Device for the administration of a measured quantity of a product. Only to be used when other terms are not applicable.
Spoon for the administration of liquid and multidose solid pharmaceutical forms.
Aid used for the administration or inhalation of a medicinal product by mouth.
Device for puncturing the skin, normally used for immunological products, especially diagnostics.
Aid used for the administration of a drug by nose.
Device for converting liquids into aerosols. Pressurised containers are excluded.
Device for injecting a medicinal product, usually a liquid, by means of high pressure without a needle, through the skin barrier. This term replaces 'High-pressure transdermal delivery device'.
Aid for the directed/targeted administration of a liquid or a semi-solid preparation to a specific site.

Administration device for administering a liquid or semi-solid pharmaceutical form to the oral cavity. It may contain one or more components necessary for the preparation of the final product (e.g. the solvent), but it does not contain the final preparation itself or all of its components; in such cases, use 'Pre-filled oral syringe' instead.
Administration device, tubular, used for the administration in drops or in accurately measured quantity of liquid pharmaceutical forms.
Device for prick testing of allergen products.
Device for scratching the skin.
Administration device with a flattened side used for the application of semi-solid pharmaceutical forms.
Device for administration by spot-on use.
Device for administering a product by stabbing the bird.
Device for introducing a sponge into the vagina of an animal.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for oral solution
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of an oral solution by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for oral suspension
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of an oral suspension by dispersing the powder in the solvent.
Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of a syrup by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solution for dental cement
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solution, both containing active substance(s), intended for the preparation of a dental cement by mixing the powder and the solution.

concept.display: Eye drops, powder and solvent for solution
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of eye drops, solution, by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Eye drops, powder and solvent for suspension
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of eye drops, suspension, by dispersing the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Ear drops, powder and solvent for suspension
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of ear drops, suspension, by dispersing the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Nasal drops, lyophilisate and solvent for suspension
concept.definition: Lyophilisate (freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of nasal drops, suspension, for veterinary use, by dispersing the lyophilisate in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for solution for injection
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a solution for injection by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for suspension for injection
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a suspension for injection by dispersing the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for solution for infusion
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a solution for infusion by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Lyophilisate and solvent for solution for injection
concept.definition: Sterile lyophilisate (freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a solution for injection, for veterinary use, by dissolving the lyophilisate in the solvent.

concept.display: Lyophilisate and suspension for suspension for injection
concept.definition: Sterile lyophilisate (freeze-dried powder) and sterile suspension, both of which contain active substance(s), intended for the preparation of a suspension for injection, for veterinary use, by dispersing the lyophilisate in the suspension.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for implantation paste
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of an implantation paste by dispersing the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Endotracheopulmonary instillation, powder and solvent for solution
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and aqueous solvent intended for the preparation of an endotracheopulmonary instillation solution by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Endotracheopulmonary instillation, powder and solvent for suspension
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and aqueous solvent intended for the preparation of an endotracheopulmonary instillation suspension by dispersing the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for endocervical gel
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of an endocervical gel by mixing the powder and the solvent.

concept.display: Fibrin sealant-powder and solvent for fibrin sealant

concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a sealant by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder for concentrate and solution for solution for infusion
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a powder for concentrate for solution for infusion and a solution for solution for infusion, intended for the preparation of a solution for infusion.

concept.display: Powder and solution for bee-hive solution
concept.definition: Powder and solution, both of which contain active ingredient(s), intended for the preparation of a bee-hive solution by dissolving the powder in the solution.

concept.display: Concentrate and solvent for concentrate for oral spray, suspension
concept.definition: Preparation for veterinary use consisting of a concentrate and a solvent intended for the preparation of a concentrate for oral spray, suspension by diluting the concentrate with the solvent; the resulting concentrate for oral spray, suspension must subsequently be diluted again before administration as an oral spray, suspension.

concept.display: Lyophilisate and solvent for oculonasal suspension
concept.definition: Lyophilisate (freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of an oculonasal suspension, for veterinary use, by dispersing the lyophilisate in the solvent.

concept.display: Emulsion and lyophilisate for suspension for injection
concept.definition: Sterile emulsion and sterile lyophilisate (freeze-dried powder) intended for the preparation of a suspension for injection, for veterinary use, by dispersing the lyophilisate in the emulsion. The emulsion contains active ingredient(s); the lyophilisate may or may not contain active ingredient(s).

concept.display: Lyophilisate and solvent for oral suspension
concept.definition: Lyophilisate (freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of an oral suspension, for veterinary use, by dispersing the lyophilisate in the solvent.

concept.display: Nasal spray, lyophilisate and solvent for suspension
concept.definition: Lyophilisate (freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of a nasal spray, suspension, for veterinary use, by dispersing the lyophilisate in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solution for bee-hive dispersion
concept.definition: Powder and solution, both of which contain active ingredient(s), intended for the preparation of a bee-hive dispersion by mixing the powder with the solution.

concept.display: Lyophilisate and solvent for emulsion for injection
concept.definition: Sterile lyophilisate (freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of an emulsion for injection, for veterinary use, by mixing the powder and the solvent.

concept.display: Effervescent powder and powder for oral suspension
concept.definition: Effervescent powder and powder intended for the preparation of an oral suspension by dissolving and/or dispersing the effervescent powder and the powder in the specified liquid(s). The effervescent powder contains active ingredient(s); the powder may or may not contain active ingredient(s).

concept.display: Powder and solution for suspension for injection
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solution, both of which contain active substance(s), intended for the preparation of a suspension for injection by dispersing the powder in the solution.

concept.display: Gastro-resistant powder and solvent for oral suspension
Concentrate and solvent for dispersion for injection
concept.definition: Sterile concentrate and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a dispersion for injection by diluting the concentrate with the solvent.

concept.display: Concentrate and solvent for intravesical solution
concept.definition: Concentrate and solvent intended for the preparation of an intravesical solution by diluting the concentrate with the solvent.

concept.display: Effervescent powder and suspension for oral suspension
concept.definition: Effervescent powder and suspension, both of which contain active ingredient(s), intended for the preparation of an oral suspension by dissolving or dispersing the effervescent powder in the suspension, or by dissolving or dispersing the effervescent powder in the specified liquid and mixing it with the suspension.

concept.display: Concentrate and solvent for emulsion for injection
concept.definition: Sterile concentrate and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of an emulsion for injection by diluting the concentrate with the solvent.

concept.display: Effervescent granules and suspension for oral suspension
concept.definition: Effervescent granules and suspension, both of which contain active ingredient(s), intended for the preparation of an oral suspension by dissolving or dispersing the effervescent granules in the suspension, or by dissolving or dispersing the effervescent granules in the specified liquid and mixing it with the suspension.

concept.display: Concentrate and solvent for oral solution
concept.definition: Concentrate and solvent intended for the preparation of an oral solution by diluting the concentrate with the solvent.

Suspension and gel intended for the preparation of a gel (for cutaneous use) by mixing the suspension in the gel. The suspension contains active ingredient(s); the gel does not contain active ingredient(s).

concept.display: Dispersion, powder and solvent for concentrate for dispersion for infusion
concept.definition: Sterile dispersion and sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder), both of which contain active ingredient(s), and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a concentrate for dispersion for infusion; it is prepared as specified in the packaging information; the resulting concentrate for dispersion for infusion must subsequently be diluted before administration as a dispersion for infusion.

concept.display: Powder and effervescent powder for oral suspension
concept.definition: Powder and effervescent powder intended for the preparation of an oral suspension by dissolving and/or dispersing the effervescent powder and the powder in the specified liquid(s). The powder contains active ingredient(s); the effervescent powder does not contain active ingredient(s).

concept.display: Powder and tablet for oral solution
concept.definition: Powder and tablet intended for the preparation of an oral solution by dissolving the powder and the tablet in the specified liquid. The powder contains active ingredient(s); the tablet may or may not contain active ingredient(s).

concept.display: Suspension and effervescent powder for oral suspension
concept.definition: Suspension and effervescent powder intended for the preparation of an oral suspension by dissolving or dispersing the effervescent powder in the suspension, or by dissolving or dispersing the effervescent powder in the specified liquid and mixing it with the suspension. The suspension contains active ingredient(s); the effervescent powder does not contain active ingredient(s).

concept.display: Powder and solvent for gastro-resistant oral suspension
concept.definition: Powder and solvent intended for the preparation of a gastro-resistant oral suspension by dispersing the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for solution for provocation test
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of a solution for provocation test by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Dispersion and solution for implantation gel
concept.definition: Dispersion and solution intended for the preparation of an implantation gel. The dispersion contains active ingredient(s); the solution may or may not contain active ingredient(s).

concept.display: Concentrate and diluent for solution for infusion
Concentrate and solvent for concentrate for solution for infusion
concept.definition: Sterile concentrate and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a concentrate for solution for infusion by diluting the concentrate with the solvent; the resulting concentrate for solution for infusion must subsequently be diluted again before administration as a solution for infusion.

concept.display: Concentrate and solvent for cutaneous solution
concept.definition: Concentrate and solvent intended for the preparation of a cutaneous solution by diluting the concentrate with the solvent.

concept.display: Concentrate and solvent for cutaneous use
Concentrate and solvent for solution for infusion
concept.definition: Sterile concentrate and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a solution for infusion by diluting the concentrate with the solvent.

concept.display: Concentrate and solvent for solution for injection
concept.definition: Sterile concentrate and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a solution for injection by diluting the concentrate with the solvent.

concept.display: Concentrate and solvent for solution for injection/infusion
concept.definition: Sterile concentrate and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a solution for injection/infusion by diluting the concentrate with the solvent.

concept.display: Concentrate and solvent for suspension for injection
concept.definition: Sterile concentrate and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a suspension for injection by diluting the concentrate with the solvent.

concept.display: Emulsion and suspension for emulsion for injection
concept.definition: Sterile emulsion and sterile suspension, both of which contain active substance(s), intended for the preparation of an emulsion for injection by mixing the emulsion and the suspension.

concept.display: Granules and solvent for oral suspension
concept.definition: Granules and solvent intended for the preparation of an oral suspension by dispersing the granules in the solvent.

concept.display: Granules and solvent for suspension for injection
concept.definition: Sterile granules and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a suspension for injection by dispersing the granules in the solvent.

concept.display: Lyophilisate and solvent for suspension for injection
concept.definition: Sterile lyophilisate (freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a suspension for injection, for veterinary use, by dispersing the lyophilisate in the solvent.
Powder and gel intended for the preparation of a gel (for cutaneous use) by mixing the powder in the gel. The powder contains active ingredient(s); the gel does not contain active ingredient(s).

concept.display: Powder and solution for solution for injection
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solution, both containing active substance(s), intended for the preparation of a solution for injection by dissolving the powder in the solution.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for concentrate for solution for infusion
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a concentrate for solution for infusion by dissolving the powder in the solvent; the resulting concentrate for solution for infusion must subsequently be diluted before administration as a solution for infusion.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for cutaneous solution
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of a cutaneous solution by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for dispersion for injection
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a dispersion for injection by dispersing the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for emulsion for injection
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of an emulsion for injection by mixing the powder and the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for endosinusial solution
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of an endosinusial solution by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for epilesional solution
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of an epilesional solution by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for gingival gel
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of a gingival gel by mixing the powder and the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for intraocular instillation solution
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of an intraocular instillation solution by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for intravesical solution
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of an intravesical solution by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for intravesical suspension
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of an intravesical suspension by dispersing the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Nasal drops, powder and solvent for solution
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of nasal drops, solution, by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for nebuliser solution
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of a nebuliser solution by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for prolonged-release suspension for injection
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a prolonged-release suspension for injection by dispersing the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for solution for injection/skin-prick test
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a solution for injection/skin-prick test by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and suspension for suspension for injection
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile suspension, both of which contain active substance(s), intended for the preparation of a suspension for injection by dispersing the powder in the suspension.

concept.display: Powder, dispersion and solvent for concentrate for dispersion for infusion
Powder, solvent and matrix for implantation matrix
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder), sterile solvent and sterile matrix intended for the preparation of an implantation matrix, for example by dissolving the powder in the solvent and using the resulting solution to impregnate the matrix. The powder contains active ingredient(s); the matrix does not contain active ingredient(s).

concept.display: Suspension and effervescent granules for oral suspension
concept.definition: Suspension and effervescent granules intended for the preparation of an oral suspension by dissolving or dispersing the effervescent granules in the suspension, or by dissolving or dispersing the effervescent granules in the specified liquid and mixing it with the suspension. The suspension contains active ingredient(s); the effervescent granules do not contain active ingredient(s).

concept.display: Suspension and solvent for suspension for injection
Tablet and solvent for rectal suspension
concept.definition: Tablet and solvent intended for the preparation of a rectal suspension by dispersing the tablet in the solvent.

concept.display: Tablet and powder for oral solution
concept.definition: Tablet and powder intended for the preparation of an oral solution by dissolving the tablet and the powder in the specified liquid. The tablet contains active ingredient(s); the powder does not contain active ingredient(s).

concept.display: Powder and solvent for dental gel
concept.definition: Powder (including freeze-dried powder) and solvent intended for the preparation of a dental gel by mixing the powder and the solvent.

concept.display: Gas and solvent for dispersion for injection/infusion
concept.definition: Sterile gas and sterile solvent, either in the same compartment or in different compartments, intended for the preparation of a dispersion for injection/infusion by dispersing the gas in the solvent.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for solution for injection/infusion
concept.definition: Sterile powder (including freeze-dried powder) and sterile solvent intended for the preparation of a solution for injection/infusion by dissolving the powder in the solvent.

concept.display: Solution for infusion in administration system
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a solution for infusion presented in an administration system.

concept.display: Solution for injection in administration system
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a solution for injection presented in an administration system.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for prolonged-release suspension for injection in pre-filled syringe
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a powder and solvent for prolonged-release suspension for injection presented in a pre-filled syringe. The powder and solvent are contained in different compartments of the pre-filled syringe, which contains all of the components necessary to prepare the prolonged-release suspension for injection.

concept.display: Powder for oral/rectal suspension in sachet
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a powder for oral/rectal suspension presented in a sachet.

concept.display: Suspension for injection in pre-filled injector
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a suspension for injection presented in a pre-filled injector.

concept.display: Solution for injection in pre-filled injector
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a solution for injection presented in a pre-filled injector.
Medicinal product consisting of a gel presented in a sachet.

concept.display: Solution for injection in dose-dispenser cartridge
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a solution for injection presented in a dose-dispenser cartridge.

concept.display: Oral suspension in pre-filled oral applicator
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of an oral suspension presented in a pre-filled oral applicator.
Medicinal product consisting of a bee-hive dispersion presented in a sachet.
Medicinal product consisting of granules presented in a single-dose container.
Medicinal product consisting of a syrup in a sachet.

concept.display: Emulsion for infusion in administration system
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of an emulsion for infusion presented in an administration system.
Medicinal product consisting of a cutaneous solution presented in a single-dose container.

concept.display: Eye drops, emulsion in single-dose container
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of an eye drops emulsion presented in a single-dose container.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for suspension for injection in multidose container
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a powder and solvent for suspension for injection presented in a multidose container; usually the powder is presented in the multidose container while the solvent is presented in a separate container, and is added to the powder in order to prepare the suspension for injection in the multidose container.

concept.display: Solution for injection in multidose container
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a solution for injection presented in a multidose container.

concept.display: Suspension for injection in multidose container
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a suspension for injection presented in a multidose container.

concept.display: Prolonged-release suspension for injection in pre-filled pen
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a prolonged-release suspension for injection presented in a pre-filled pen.
Medicinal product consisting of a nasal powder presented in a single-dose container, usually with an integral device to facilitate nasal administration.
Medicinal product consisting of a solution for infusion presented in a cartridge, intended to be used in a specially designed device such as an infusion pump.
Medicinal product consisting of an oral powder presented in a single-dose container.
Medicinal product consisting of a transdermal gel presented in a sachet.

concept.display: Oral solution in multidose container with metering pump
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of an oral solution presented in a multidose container with metering pump.

concept.display: Powder for oral suspension in sachet
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a powder for oral suspension presented in a sachet.
Medicinal product consisting of film-coated granules presented in a single-dose container.

concept.display: Dispersion for injection in pre-filled syringe
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a dispersion for injection presented in a pre-filled syringe.

concept.display: Granules for gastro-resistant oral suspension in sachet
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of granules for gastro-resistant oral suspension presented in a sachet.

concept.display: Granules for prolonged-release oral suspension in sachet
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of granules for prolonged-release oral suspension presented in a sachet.
Medicinal product consisting of an intracameral implant presented in an applicator.

concept.display: Prolonged-release solution for injection in pre-filled pen
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a prolonged-release solution for injection presented in a pre-filled pen.
Medicinal product consisting of film-coated granules presented in a sachet.
Medicinal product consisting of coated granules presented in a sachet.

concept.display: Ear drops, solution in single-dose container
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of an ear drops solution presented in a single-dose container.

concept.display: Ear drops, suspension in single-dose container
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of an ear drops suspension presented in a single-dose container.

concept.display: Emulsion for injection/infusion in pre-filled syringe
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of an emulsion for injection/infusion presented in a pre-filled syringe.

concept.display: Eye drops, prolonged-release solution in single-dose container
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a prolonged-release eye drops solution presented in a single-dose container.

concept.display: Eye drops, solution in single-dose container
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of an eye drops solution presented in a single-dose container.

concept.display: Eye drops, suspension in single-dose container
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of an eye drops suspension presented in a single-dose container.
Medicinal product consisting of an eye gel presented in a single-dose container.
Medicinal product consisting of an eye ointment presented in a single-dose container.

concept.display: Film-coated tablet and gastro-resistant granules in sachet
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a film-coated tablet and gastro-resistant granules presented together in a sachet and intended to be swallowed together as a single dose. If two or more tablets are present to make up the dose, the term Film-coated tablets and gastro-resistant granules in sachet is used.

concept.display: Gastro-resistant granules for oral suspension in sachet

concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a gel presented in a pressurised container.

concept.display: Granules for oral solution in sachet
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of granules for oral solution presented in a sachet.

concept.display: Granules for oral suspension in sachet
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of granules for oral suspension presented in a sachet.

Medicinal product consisting of granules presented in a sachet, the entire contents of which are intended for oral administration as a single dose. For reasons of patient safety and to ensure the correct administration of the medicinal product, this term may also be used where the contents are in fact very small tablets rather than granules, and where the entire contents of the sachet are intended for oral administration as a single dose, rather than the tablets being individually counted out at the time of administration.
Medicinal product consisting of a herbal tea enclosed in a porous bag (a tea bag) intended to be placed in water for the preparation of an oral aqueous preparation on one occasion only.
Medicinal product consisting of an implant presented in a pre-filled syringe.
Medicinal product consisting of an intravitreal implant presented in an applicator.

concept.display: Nasal drops, solution in single-dose container
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a nasal drops solution presented in a single-dose container.

concept.display: Powder and solvent for prolonged-release suspension for injection in pre-filled pen
concept.definition: Medicinal product consisting of a powder and solvent for prolonged-release suspension for injection presented in a pre-filled pen.
